comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Viscount Haldane and General Townsley are leaving the old Hayes Gym. However it did not gain the name "Hayes Gym" until named in honor of Captain Thomas Jay Hayes, IV; killed in action 17 April, 1968. Here's a photo of the whole building. Entry door at left. commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Old_Hayes_Gym_1910.jpg The Hayes Gym, built in 1910 is still (2009) largely intact and now a part of the larger Arvin facility. Some deatils here including archtecural credit to Cram Goodhue & Ferguson: wapedia.mobi/en/Hayes_Gymnasium

comment._content:

Bob, that baby face of yours looks familiar from another "Life." Welcome back.
